channel.title: CiTR -- Karasu (2007)
channel.description: Love Japanese music? Karasu is an eclectic program that introduces various . independent and mainstream Japanese artists. Listen to Alex as he plays Shibuya Pop, Tokyo Ska, and other fine tunes while he talks about arts and entertainment in both Japanese and English.
channel.itunes:summary: Love Japanese music? Karasu is an eclectic program that introduces various . independent and mainstream Japanese artists. Listen to Alex as he plays Shibuya Pop, Tokyo Ska, and other fine tunes while he talks about arts and entertainment in both Japanese and English.
channel.itunes:author: CiTR 101.9 Vancouver
channel.itunes:subtitle: Independent and mainstream Japanese music. Shibuya Pop, Tokyo Ska, etc.

item.title: 29-Oct-2007
item.description: Jeepers and creepers! A show on Japanese eerie urban legends and odd, funny n' heavy music that'll come along with it.
item.itunes:subtitle: HALLOWEEN SHOW!

item.description: A talk on Japanese horror flicks and a guest from Bloodshots Horror Film Competition.

item.title: Broadcast on 30-Jul-2007
item.description:
Good blend of contemporary and traditional music to promote the upcoming Powell Street Festival this weekend!!

item.title: Broadcast on 16-Jul-2007
item.description:
Tonight's show will be focusin gon Japanese robots: the tech's, the specs, and music that reflect the giant eletrikku robotto!
Playlist for July 16th, 2007:
1) Doddodo:ABCDOSAKA 2) toddle:Step With the Gloom 3) Polysics: Cyborg Kanojyo 4) Nanao Tabito: Blue Hunting 5) Supercar: White Surf Style 5 6) Yoko Kanno: Smile 7) Rovo: Kmara 8)Mondo Grosso : Everything Needs Love (feat. Cornelius) 9) After Dinner : Paradise of Replica 10) Nyantora: Jupiter 11) The Aprils : Twinkle of the Stars, Little Stars, Shining Stars 12) DJ Krush: Silent Ungah (Too Much Pain) 13) Zoobombs : C'mon and Get Down
item.itunes:subtitle: Japanese Robots

item.title: Karasu
item.description:
After a two hour drive from work (damn gridlock on the bridge,) I makeit on tim efor today's show! New artists discovered include Michio Kurihara and Ghost. Latest music from Toddle and Bloodthirsty Butchers as well!
Playlist (Artist:Song):
1) Toddle:In a Balloon 2) Yura Yura Teikoku: Wakatte Hoshii 3) Boris/Michio Kurihara: Sweet No. 1 4) Ghost: Hazy Paradise 5) 54 Nude Honeys: Where is Love 6) Spangle Call Lilli Line: with in zz/oo!! 7) ROVO: Mattah 8) Stance Punks: Let It Rock 9) Zazen Boys: Riff Man 10) Bloodthirsty Burchers: Guitarist wo Korosanaide 11) Miki Furukawa: Chick Schick Radio 12) School Girl '69: Fork and Knife 13) Shugo Tokumaru: Kiiro 14) Silver Fins: Looking Down the Flow 15) Pizzicato Five: Passing By
item.itunes:subtitle: July 9th

item.title: Karasu
item.description:
A selection of Japanese tunes with summer as their theme!
Playlist: 1) Vola and the Oriental Machine: Mexico Pub 2) Puffy: Umi E To 3) Bloodthirsty Butchers: Poolside 4) Thee Michelle Gun Elephant: Naked Sun 5) Natsumen: Natsu no Mujina 6) Sanbomaster: Utsukushiki Ningen no Hibi 7) Quruli: O Matsuri Wasshoi 8) ROVO: Spica 9) Number Girl: Hadashi no Kisetsu 10) Eastern Youth: Natsu No Hikari 11) Supercar: Summer Tune 12) Soil and Pimp Sessions: Summer Goddess
item.itunes:subtitle: Summer Time Special!

item.title: Featured Artist of the Month
item.description: For all those Shibuya-kei Pop lovers... a one and a half hour show on Pizzicato Five!!
item.itunes:subtitle: Pizzicato Five

item.title: Broadcast on 30-Apr-2007
item.description: Tonight's Artist of the Month will be focusing on Cornelius, a highly acclaimed producer that has got international attention. Starting from his EP album Holiday in the Sun, then to 69/96; Fantasma; Point; PM; and to his latest release Sensuous.

item.title: Japanese Indie Tribute
item.description: An hour long program focusing on one of the biggest Japanese indie rock bands: Number Girl!
item.itunes:subtitle: Number Girl

item.title: Hinamatsuri: Girl's Festival
item.description: An all-women Japanese artist show for the Hinamatsuri holidays (March 3rd: Girls' Festival!) A story on the Akihabara cosplay, and homelesses taking over Internet cafes for cheap shelter!? Music playlist include YMCK, Shonen Knife, and Deerhoof.

item.title: Karasu
item.description:
Featured artist of the Month: DJ Krush!
A former yakuza turned prominent mixmaster and turntablist, DJ Krush has taken trip-hop to a different level with the help of high profile artists.
item.itunes:subtitle: DJ Krush

item.title: Karasu
item.description: Okay, so the show has nothing to do with the Year of the Pig. But I will talk about bands such as Spangle Call Lilli Line, Zazen Boys, and Condor 44. Who needs traditional Japanese instruments to play some great music from Japan? (Don't get me wrong: I LOVE SHAKUHACHI and SHAMISEN!) Enjoy yourselves.
item.itunes:subtitle: Chiense New Year!

item.title: Karasu
item.description: Have a whole list of new music that I've discovered recently! New bands include cali gari, Ging Nang Boyz, and Zoobombs.

item.title: Karasu
item.description: A 90-minute exclusive feature on one of the most influential pop/rock/electronica band in Japan: Supercar!
item.itunes:subtitle: Ippon Band Exclusive: Featuring Band of the Day: Supercar

item.title: Karasu
item.description: Podcasting is back and alive at CiTR! Woohoohoo!
item.itunes:subtitle: Podcasting is Back!

item.title: Karasu
item.description: Happy 2007! An introduction to how Japan celebrates New Years along with rocking tunes to start your year with a bang.
item.itunes:subtitle: New Years Show!

item.title: Karasu
item.description: Merry Christmas! A selection of Japanese music that is for the holidays!
item.itunes:subtitle: Christmas Show!

item.title: Karasu
item.description: Great selections of J-indie as well as reports on jellyfish being the gift and the curse of the fish industry! A talk on a man attempting to be in the records book on memorizing the pi.
item.itunes:subtitle: Remember your Pi, Jellyfish as New Japanese Cuisine!

item.title: Karasu
item.description: An amazing story on how a hiker survived for 22 days when he broke his pelvis... by sipping on BBQ sauce! Also info on Whiteman Project, Eiffel Tower made of bread, and many more!
item.itunes:subtitle: BBQ Sauce can go a Long Way

item.title: Karasu
item.description: After an unexpected snowfall, CiTR s back on the air! Some information on the world's hardest working man, Most Expenive Hello Kitty Accessory, and how pachinko may be associated with nuclear tests.
item.itunes:subtitle: Back on the Air!

item.title: Karasu
item.description: CiTR fundraiser! Please make a pledge!
item.itunes:subtitle: Need Cash for CITR!

item.title: Karasu
item.description: Heavy rockin', dark tunes by Japanese bangers with some trivia on Japanese ghosts and legends.
item.itunes:subtitle: Hallowe'en Show

item.title: Karasu
item.description: Wonderful traditional and jazzy/modern tunes by Akamatsu Takehiko, Yoshida Brothers, and Uzume Taiko. A special interview/live performance by Vancouver shakuhachi performer Alcvin Takegawa Ramos as well!
item.itunes:subtitle: Traditional Insturments in Contemporary Style: Shamisen, Shakuhachi, and Taiko

item.title: Karasu
item.description: A show filled with Japanese indie-rock, with quirky news including chocolate baths, robot sprint races, and how a mother gives birth to her own granddaughter.
item.itunes:subtitle: Mother Giving Birth to Own Granddaughter!?

item.title: Karasu
item.description: Guest interview: Raymond Nakamura, former Mokuyokai Society president talkign about the matcha festival, and green tea!
item.itunes:subtitle: Green Tea Matcha Festival!

item.title: Karasu
item.description: A little talk on Japanese October festivals and Hula dancing for Japanese businessmen? FIlled with Japanese indie rock, hiphop, and many more!
item.itunes:subtitle: Hula Dancing and Japanese October Festivals
